PerformancePlanOrReport.Name: 2022 - 2023 Performance Report
PerformancePlanOrReport.Description: This report covers results achieved by participants in the Strategy Markup Language (StratML) community during 2022 - 2023. It is cumulative in the sense that it also documents results previously accomplished. There are now more than 5,800 files in the StratML collection.
PerformancePlanOrReport.OtherInformation: Please let us know if you have proposed additions or corrections. Comments and suggestions with respect to prospective goals and objectives are also welcome, particularly if you would like to participate in developing StratML tools, applications, and services.

Role.Name: Former SDO
Role.Description: ANSI-Accredited Standards Development Organization. AIIM abandoned its standards program, including the PDF standard, and is no longer serving this role.

Role.Name: Best Practice Provider
Role.Description: AIIM continues to make StratML Part 3, Additional Elements, available as a best practice document (AIIM 24:2014), at https://www.aiim.org/Resources/Standards/AIIM_24

Role.Name: Prospective SDO
Role.Description: Prospective ANSI-Accredited Standards Development Organization. Since AIIM abandoned its standards program, including the PDF standard, the 3D PDF Consortium agreed to serve this role but has not yet received accreditation.

Role.Name: Chair, StratML Working Group
Role.Description: Technically speaking, since AIIM has abandoned its standards program and the 3D PDF Consortium has not yet achieved ANSI accreditation to assume responsibility for the program, the StratML working group has not yet formally been reconstituted.

Role.Name: Chief Technical Community Steward, OASIS
Role.Description: Chet and Owen are exploring prospects for having OASIS assume stewardship of the StratML standard. The draft charter is available at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1td2ch0PqiHUGE3tP4kvyY2wVQRWwjGUNjdArsO8zApU/edit

Role.Name: Former StratML Committee Co-Chair
Role.Description: With the completion and approval of Part 2 as an ANSI/AIIM standard, Adam deemed his work on the committee to have been completed and resigned his role as co-chair in 2011.

Role.Name: Director of Standards, 3D PDF Consortium
Role.Description: Formerly AIIM Director of Standards.

Role.Name: Leader, NIEM Task Group
Role.Description: Sylvia is lead a task group to develop a NIEM implementation profile for StratML

Role.Name: StratML Portal Developer
Role.Description: Andre developed a StratML portal, including an XSLT form enabling the drafting and editing of StratML documents.

Stakeholder.Name: Art Colman
Stakeholder.Description: Unfortunately, it seems that Art may have passed away. We have been unable to contact him. His profile lives on in LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/artcolman/ However, his website has disappeared.

Role.Name: Schema Maintenance
Role.Description: Art formerly maintained the official copies of the schema while under development, prior to approval and publication of the standard.

Role.Name: Data Dictionary Producer
Role.Description: Art also automatically generated user-friendly data dictionaries (in MS Word format) from the StratML schemas.

Role.Name: StratML Query Service Developer
Role.Description: Together with Hari Sandeep Reddy, Ranjeeth plans to develop a StratML query service based upon IBM technology.

Stakeholder.Name: Hari Sandeep Reddy
Stakeholder.Description: Together with Ranjeeth Thunga, Hari plans to develop a StratML query service based upon IBM technology.

Role.Name: StratML Query Service Developer
Role.Description: Together with Hari Sandeep Reddy, Ranjeeth plans to develop a StratML query service based upon IBM technology.

Vision.Description: A worldwide web of intentions, stakeholders, and results.

Mission.Description: To foster awareness and usage as well as updating and maintenance of Strategy Markup Language (StratML), an XML-based voluntary consensus standard for the information commonly contained in strategic and performance plans and reports.

Goal.Name: Strategic Plans
Goal.Description: Specify and foster usage of an XML standard for the information commonly contained in strategic plans.

Objective.Name: ANSI/AIIM Publication
Objective.Description: Publish Part 1, Strategic Plans, as an American (ANSI/AIIM) national standard.

TargetResult.Description: Publication of Part 1.

ActualResult.Description: Part 1 was approved and published as ANSI/AIIM 21:2009.

Objective.Name: StratML Part 1 Files
Objective.Description: Convert strategic plans into StratML format to demonstrate and prove the elements of the standard.

TargetResult.Description: Unspecified

ActualResult.Description: More than 800 plans were converted to StratML Part 1 format.
More than a thousand plans were converted to StratML Part 1 format, an increase of more than 230 during calendar year 2012.
Nearly 1,500 additional plans were converted to StratML format in 2013, bringing the total to more than 2,500.
During 2014, 545 more plans were converted to StratML format, bringing the total to 3,055.
During 2015, 350 more plans were converted to StratML format, bringing the total to 3,405.
More than 760 plans were converted.
Nearly 300 plans were added to the collection.
196 plans were added to the collection in the past 4 months.
161 plans were added during February through June 2020. For the most recently available number, see http://stratml.us/carmel/catalogsitemap.html

During the latter half of 2020, about 186 more files were added to the StratML collection, bringing the total to more than 5,000. However, of that total, about 59 are Part 1 files. So the actual total number of Part 1 files is about 4,949.
During the first half of 2021, about 136 more files were added to the StratML collection, bringing the total to 5,144.
Since the last report, 681 files have been added to the collection.

Role.Description: Provided a validation service for StratML Part 1 files. See http://stratml.us#NIST

Stakeholder.Description: Chairman of the Board, Institute of the Information Society - Russia

Role.Name: Russian Translator
Role.Description: Translated the StratML Core from English to Russian and translated from Russian to English the Strategy for the Informational Society Development in the Russian Federation.

Stakeholder.Name: Robin LaFontaine
Stakeholder.Description: Robin is with DeltaXML and participated in the W3C's change tracking group.

Role.Name: Change Tracking Demonstrator
Role.Description: Robin provided change tracking renditions of the National Association of Government Communicators (NAGC) by-laws in StratML format.

Role.Name: CMS Developer
Role.Description: William expressed interest in developing a CMS application with the capability to output data in StratML format.

Role.Name: XBRL Converter
Role.Description: Frederic supplied an Excel Data Point Model with the capability to generate an XBRL taxonomy for StratML.

Role.Name: XSLTForms Developer
Role.Description: Alain maintains the XSLT code enabling the development of XForms which can be used to create StratML files. For more information on his efforts, see http://www.agencexml.com/xsltforms.htm

Role.Name: oXygen Developer
Role.Description: George incorporated support for the StratML standard into oXygen, including the ISO version of Part 1. He also provided a stylesheet to transform files from the ANSI version of Part 1 to the ISO version.

Role.Name: StratML Portal Developer
Role.Description: Alejandro and his colleagues at Ximdex have imported the StratML collection into Xcms and are demonstrating faceted query capabilities.

Role.Name: StraML Application Developer
Role.Description: Yuriy plans to build support for the StratML standard into his Ripplio Assistant application.

Role.Name: StratML Application Developer
Role.Description: Chris is working to enable StratML output from his Strategic Learning application.

Role.Name: StratML Query Service Developer
Role.Description: Naval has developed and will continue to work on enhancements to a StratML-enabled query service at https://search.aboutthem.info/.

TargetResult.Description: Development of prototypical tools, applications, and services.

ActualResult.Description: A couple dozen prototypical tools, applications, and services have been developed. They are documented and links are provided at http://stratml.us#Forms & http://stratml.us#Services.
oXygen 17 became the first commercial release of a product supporting the ISO version of StratML Part 1 (ISO 17469-1).
In 2023 a StratML-enabled query service was developed and made available at https://search.aboutthem.info/

Objective.Name: ISO Standard
Objective.Description: Obtain approval and publication of Part 1 as an international (ISO) voluntary consensus standard, for potential use by all organizations worldwide.

Role.Name: Technical Editor
Role.Description: Betsy performed the final edits for publication of Part 1 as an ISO standard.

Role.Name: Technical Editor
Role.Description: Sylvia edited the graphical presentation of the schema and also provided the new namespace to replace stratml.net.

Role.Name: Technical Editing Assistance
Role.Description: Richard provided assistance in editing the graphical presentation of the schema.

TargetResult.Description: Publication of Part 1 as an ISO standard.
StratML Part 1, the StratML Core, is up for 5-year review and renewal in the ISO process.

ActualResult.Description: StratML Part 1 was registered at ISO and assigned number ISO/NP 17469-1. Five nations -- Canada, South Africa, China, and Korea in addition to the U.S. -- agreed to work on the international standard.
Responses to comments on StratML Part 1 posted to the ISO/TC 171/SC 2 eCommittee by Betsy Fanning, May 8, 2012.
Part 1 was approved as an ISO standard in October 2013. Publication is anticipated in 2014, after a few editorial corrections are made.

Part 1 was published as ISO 17469-1 on February 11, 2015, and may be purchased from ANSI at https://www.iso.org/standard/59859.html The schema is freely available on the Web for usage by anyone who chooses to do so, at http://stratml.us/references/StrategicPlanISOVersion20140401.xsd

Betsy Fanning E-mailed a ballot to the StratML Committee members to determine whether the standard is still valid. Responses are due by March 20. A committee meeting will be scheduled shortly after the ballot closes to review the voting results that will be sent to the US TAG to ISO TC171 SC2 for validation prior to being sent as the US vote.
Betsy Fanning advised that the StratML Committee has voted to reaffirm Part 1 as an international standard. The next step is a 30-day review in the ANSI process.
Betsy Fanning advised that Part 1 has been reaffirmed as an ISO standard (ISO 17469-1) for another five years.

Objective.Name: Training
Objective.Description: Provide training materials to assist developers and users of the StratML standard.

Role.Name: Tutorial Creator
Role.Description: Owen drafted a PowerPoint presentation with instructions on how to use Joe Carmel's XForms form to create StratML Part 1 (ISO 17469-1) files.

Role.Name: AI/ML Service Trainer
Role.Description: Owen has begun training AI/ML services to understand and eventually begin to apply the StratML schemas to relevant content on the Web.

Role.Name: Narrator
Role.Description: William narrated the tutorial.

Role.Name: Tutorial Publisher
Role.Description: Betsy made the module available in the education and training section of AIIM's website.

TargetResult.Description: The training module is made available on AIIM's website.

ActualResult.Description: As of February 3, 2016, the training module was available on AIIM's website for access by AIIM members.

TargetResult.Description: TBD

ActualResult.Description: TBD

TargetResult.Description: Train Al/ML services to comprehend and, eventually, apply the StratML schemas to relevant content on the Web.

ActualResult.Description: While it does not appear that any AI/ML services are yet capable of comprending the semantics and structure of XSDs, ChatGPT has learned to provide a good explanation of the need and justification for using the StratML standard. https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/trustworthy-institutions-owen-ambur/

Bard enthusiastically agrees, "Publishing performance plans and reports in an open, machine-readable format like StratML Part 2 is a fantastic way for charitable organizations to demonstrate their commitment to impact and results, fostering greater trust and transparency with stakeholders." https://bard.google.com/share/7abb5856005d
Bard says, "The potential relationships between StratML and DAOs are promising and warrant further exploration. " https://bard.google.com/share/b5b052df8f19
Bard sees StratML's approach as a powerful and practical way to build a valuable ontology for the strategic planning domain. https://bard.google.com/share/d7b0d4b12a7c

Goal.Name: Performance Plans and Reports
Goal.Description: Specify and foster usage of an XML standard extending Part 1 to include the additional information commonly contained in performance plans and reports.

Objective.Name: ANSI/AIIM Publication
Objective.Description: Publish Part 2, Performance Plans and Reports, as an American (ANSI/AIIM) national standard.

TargetResult.Description: Publication of Part 2
Harmonization with ISO 17469-1.
Since consideration of Part 2 has been delayed in the ISO process, both harmonization and enhancement will be initiated in the ANSI process.

ActualResult.Description: Part 2 was approved and published as ANSI/AIIM 22:2011.
Part 2 was harmonized with minor changes made to Part 1 (ISO 17469-1) in the ISO process and republished as ANSI/AIIM 22:2017.

Since AIIM abandoned its standards program, ANSI no longer recognizes StratML as an American national standard. Efforts have been made to reconstitute AIIM's standards program under the auspices of another organization but thus far that has not occurred.

TargetResult.Description: Conduct regular teleconferences to receive input and discuss the additional elements to be included in Part 2.

ActualResult.Description: The StratML Committee conducted eight teleconferences on the following dates: January 5, March 22, August 24, September 22, October 6, October 20, November 3 and December 1.

Objective.Name: StratML Part 2 Files
Objective.Description: Convert performance plans and reports into StratML format to demonstrate and prove the elements of the standard.

Role.Name: StratML Portal Developer
Role.Description: Andre's StratML portal automatically transforms all of the Part 1 files into Part 2 format.

Role.Name: Database Converter
Role.Description: Gannon transformed data from the Federal Advisory Committee Act (FACA) database into StratML format. He is also working on converting IRS data for tax-exempt organizations to StratML format.

Role.Name: StratML Part 2 File Creator
Role.Description: Owen has manually converted a number of performance reports into StratML Part 2 format.

TargetResult.Description: Unspecified

ActualResult.Description: Thirteen performance plans and reports were converted to StratML Part 2 format.
Nineteen performance plans and reports were converted to StratML Part 2 format, an increase of 6 during 2012.
The total number of Part 2 files on the StratML.us site is now nearly 60. However, they are not well populated with performance indicators and stakeholder roles.

TargetResult.Description: [Unspecified]

ActualResult.Description: When importing them into his portal, Andre Cusson converted all StratML files into Part 2 format. As of November 20, 2013, his portal contained more than 2,400 files comprising more than 23,000 objectives, nearly 60,000 stakeholders, and more than 70,000 pages.

TargetResult.Description: [Unspecified]

ActualResult.Description: Chris Fox enables authoring/editing of StratML files in both Part 1 and Part 2 format in his StratNavApp. So, potentially speaking, any or all of the files in the collection could be imported into his app. However, relatively few have been. About 50 files are publicly available in his site, at https://www.stratnavapp.com/PublicProjects

Objective.Name: Tools, Applications & Services
Objective.Description: Foster the development of tools, applications, and services supporting and leveraging the StratML standard for the benefit of various communities of interest.

Role.Name: Portal Developer
Role.Description: Andre has developed a StratML portal for both Part 1 & Part 2 files.

Role.Name: XSLT Form Developer
Role.Description: Andre has developed an XSLT form for both Part 1 & Part 2.

Role.Name: InfoPath Form Developer
Role.Description: Owen has created InfoPath forms for Part 1 & Part 2.

Role.Name: StratML Course Developer
Role.Description: Carlos is developing a training course for StratML.

Role.Name: StratML Query Service Developer
Role.Description: Matt quickly developed and and briefly hosted JSON/MongoDB-based StratML indexing/browsing/query service. See http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/index.htm#Uberity

Role.Name: StratML Query Service Developer
Role.Description: Duane worked with Matt MacKenzie on a JSON/MongoDB-based StratML indexing/browsing/query service. See http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/index.htm#Uberity

Role.Name: Schema Development Tool Support
Role.Description: Ivan made available the enterprise edition of Stylus Studio to support development of the schema for StratML Part 3.

Role.Name: Sr. Account Manager
Role.Description: Jay is a Sr. Account Manager at MarkLogic.

Role.Name: StratML Search Service Developer
Role.Description: Jay is worked with Andy Obermayer to re-develop MarkLogic's StratML search service.

Role.Name: Technical Sales Engineer
Role.Description: Andy is a Technical Sales Engineer at MarkLogic

Role.Name: StratML Search Service Developer
Role.Description: Andy Obermayer worked to re-develop MarkLogic's StratML search service.

Role.Name: StratML Application Promoter
Role.Description: Allyson met with the Executive Director of the non-profit Ballston Improvement District (BID) to understand their priorities for the BID's published strategic plan. They are interested in being able to track their performance and showing the progress being made relative to their high-level objectives, especially to their main stakeholder and oversight authority, the Arlington County Board of Supervisors.

Role.Name: Yala Developer
Role.Description: Geoffrey is developing a service called The Yala, "a platform for collaboration, designed to aid the emergence of collective intelligence." http://yalaworld.net/About/tabid/84/Default.aspx He expressed intent to try to incorporate the StratML standard into his service.

Role.Name: Co-Founder of Chicdata
Role.Description: Chicdata's mission is provide software to create strategic plans and regulatory reports that can be shared, published, and accessed the across the globe.

Role.Name: Co-Developer of StartML
Role.Description: StartML is an acronym for Strategy And Regulatory Tax Management Launchpad. It is a software platform based on the ANSI AIIM Strategy Markup Language (StratML) standard created to ensure that all non-profit and for-profit companies can easily create strategic plans, and government agencies can publish strategic plans for public consumption in compliance with recent government-published standards.

Role.Name: White Paper Drafter
Role.Description: Lead the drafting a white paper addressing the benefits of use of the StratML by the private sector.

Role.Name: White Paper Drafter
Role.Description: Assist Ranjeeth in drafting a white paper addressing the benefits of use of the StratML by the private sector.

Role.Name: NIEM Comparison
Role.Description: David prepared spreadsheets comparing StratML Part 2 to NIEM: http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/references/NIEMComparison20100205.xlsx & http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/references/NIEMComparison20100419.xls

Role.Name: Software Developer
Role.Description: Built support for StratML Part 2 into oXygen, including a form-based user interface.

Role.Name: Hebrew Translator
Role.Description: Pini provided Hebrew translations for many of the elements of the StratML standard.

Role.Name: StratML Catalog & Form Developer
Role.Description: Marten has set up a publicly accessible catalog based on ESRI's open source Geoportal Server with the StratML Part 1 and Part 2 configured. Users can register and publish their own plans &/or the plans of organizations whose missions are of interest to them, either by uploading preexisting plans or by using the forms-based interface provided in the portal. Marten plans to maintain it to test ESRI's stratml implementation.

Role.Name: XForms Developer
Role.Description: Joe developed an XForms form for StratML Part 2.

Role.Name: XForms Developer
Role.Description: In 2018 Ibrahim updated Joe Carmel's Part 2 form for hosting on the stratml.us site at http://stratml.us/forms/Part2Form.xml to accommodate changes made in ANSI/AIIM 22:2017.

Role.Name: Stylesheet Editor
Role.Description: In the fall of 2018, Ibrahim updated the stylesheet to accommodate the new Descriptor element in the Performance Indicators table. He also provided an alternative version that inserts mailto links for comments on goals and objectives.

Role.Name: Stylesheet Editor
Role.Description: Colin edited the stylesheet to improve the presentation of the performance indicator tables.

Role.Name: Stylesheet Editor
Role.Description: Mario edited the stylesheet to further improve the presentation of the data.

Role.Name: Stylesheet Editor
Role.Description: Detlef edited the stylesheet to further improve the presentation of the data.

Role.Name: PDF & ePub Converter
Role.Description: John provided the capability to transform and present StratML files in PDF and ePub format.

Role.Name: Wizard Form Developer
Role.Description: Jorge is developing a multi-stage wizard form to make it easier to create and edit StratML files.

Role.Name: Spanish Label Provider
Role.Description: Jorge provided a rendition of the StratML Part 2 form with the capability to translate the field labels from English to Spanish.

Role.Name: XForm Editor
Role.Description: Alain has been making corrections and enhancements to the StratML Part 2 form. His version of the form at http://waterland.freeboxos.fr:8009/Part2Form.xml is being used to edit this plan/report.

Role.Name: StratML Database Provider
Role.Description: On December 9, 2018, Adam put up an eXist database to host StratML files. However, it has apparently been taken down as his company pursues an alternative to eXist, called Granite.

Role.Name: StratML Database Instructor
Role.Description: On March 20, 2019, Peter posted on GitHub basic instructions on how to build a StratML query service using BaseX. https://github.com/pwin/StratML-Search/blob/master/README.md

Role.Name: StratML-to-PDF Converter
Role.Description: Jeff has used Turn-Key System's TopLeaf application to render StratML files in PDF.

Role.Name: StratML App Developer
Role.Description: Chris' StratNavApp outputs files in both StratML Part 1 and 2 formats.

Role.Name: Schema.org Integrator
Role.Description: Chris set up a Google custom query based on Schema.Org Person and Organization types. His StratNavApp generates Schema.org tagged files from the same data used to create StratML files. Doing so may improve discovery of those files by Google, based upon queries of those elements.

TargetResult.Description: Forms are readily available online for the creation and editing of StratML Part 2 files.

ActualResult.Description: An XSLT form and an InfoPath form are available.
George Bina has added a form-based user interface to oXygen for StratML Part 2, bringing to three the total number of forms available for Part 2.
Marten Hogeweg provided a forms-based authoring/editing interface in Geoportal Server, bringing to four the total number of forms available for Part 2.
Joe Carmel developed an XForms form for Part 2, but Andre Cusson's form was disabled by a Java security update. So the number of forms supporting Part 2 remained at three.

Joe Carmel's XForms for StratML Parts 1 & 2 have been rehosted on the StratML.us site. ESRI has apparently abandoned its StratML portal, and while Ximdex's StratML query prototype remains available, they apparently have disabled their StratML form. However, Jorge Sanchez is perfecting his wizard form. So while the number of forms available for the creation and editing of files in StratML Part 2 format has fallen to two, it may soon increase to three.
Alain Barbet has posted an improved version of the Part 2 form at http://waterland.freeboxos.fr:8009/Part2Form.xml So there are now 3 instance of the form.
Chris Fox provides a form-based interface to create and edit StratML files in his StratNavApp. It supports StratML Parts 1 & 2 as well as some elements of Part 3.

TargetResult.Description: Although presentation is expressly not part of the StratML standard itself, a stylesheet(s) should be provided to attractively display files.

ActualResult.Description: Colin Mackenzie updated the stylesheet previously developed by Ken Holman, Joe Carmel, and Andre Cusson.
During the month of April, Mario Madunic and Detlef Heyn further enhanced the presentation of StratML files by updating the stylesheet.
John Baker enhanced his capability to render StratML files in PDF for more visually appealing presentation and printing.
John Barker is retiring his StratML-to-PDF conversion service. However, Chris Fox offers styling of StratML files on his StratNavApp. So the number of available stylesheets remains at three.
Turn-Key Systems picked up and maintaining John Barker's StratML-to-PDF conversion stylesheet.

TargetResult.Description: Help Charity Navigator address challenges to implementation of their 3.0 initiative, focusing on results.
Gannon Dick plans to transform to StratML format the data that IRS holds for more than 800,000 tax-exempt organizations, for use with the template that Owen has drafted.

ActualResult.Description: On January 6, Owen Ambur, Gannon Dick, and Susan Smoter engaged in a teleconference with Michael Thatcher, president & CEO of Charity Navigator, to explore prospects for using StratML Part 2 to support their 3.0 initiative.
Using Joe Carmel's XForms form, Owen Ambur compiled a template in StratML Part 2 format that charities could use to publish their performance plans and reports.
John Barker provided the capabilty to render StratML files in PDF and ePub format.
John Barker is retiring his StratML-to-PDF conversion service. During the period it was available 595 StratML files were rendered in PDF, comprising about 60 megabytes.

Turn-Key Systems has picked up John Barker's stylesheet and used it to continue rendering StratML files in PDF. As of November 21, 2021, it has been used to render about five dozen plans and reports in PDF.
Turn-Key Systems stopped offering its StratML-to-PDF conversion service, but before they did, more than 700 additional plans had been converted.
During 2023 a StratML-enabled query service was developed and made available at https://search.aboutthem.info/

Objective.Name: NIEM Implementation Profile
Objective.Description: Create an implementation profile for inclusion of StratML into a new Planning and Accountability domain in the National Information Exchange Model (NIEM).

Role.Name: Deputy CIO, Department of Health and Human Services
Planning & Accountability Domain Proponent
Role.Description: John proposed inclusion of a Planning and Accountability domain in NIEM.

TargetResult.Description: Creation of an implementation profile to support incorporation of the StratML standard into NIEM.

ActualResult.Description: On January 4, 2011, President Obama signed H.R. 2142, the GPRA Modernization Act of 2010 (GPRAMA), into law as P.L. 111-352. Section 2 requires agencies to publish their strategic plans on their websites and section 10 requires them to publish their strategic and performance plans and reports in searchable, machine-readable format. StratML is such a format.
Sylvia Webb is leading a task group developing the NIEM profile.
Sylvia & Allyson created a spreadsheet tentatively mapping the elements of StratML to elements of NIEM. It is available at http://vision4standards.com/stratml-wip/
Due to lack of expression of interest from NIEM leaders, the StratML Committee has placed the NIEM profile on indefinite hold.

In the June 28, 2019, issuance of Circular A-11, OMB indicated implementation of section of GPRAMA will be piloted with a few agencies during FY 2020. See http://stratml.us/carmel/iso/A11-240wStyle.xml#_aada4d70-a90a-11e9-a082-d69e4d1a686a

In the Federal Data Strategy Action Plan for 2020, OMB has indicated that a data standards registry will leverage NIEM and other existing repositories, but it is unclear whether that means the schema for agency performance reports will be included. See http://stratml.us/carmel/iso/part2/2020APwStyle.xml#_b19de10e-2dd4-11ea-a6d4-d5cd0183ea00

Objective.Name: ISO Standard
Objective.Description: Obtain approval and publication of Part 2 as an international (ISO) voluntary consensus standard, for potential use by all organizations worldwide.

Role.Name: Schema Editor
Role.Description: Owen edited the ANSI/AIIIM 22:2011 version of the schema to incorporate the changes in ISO 17469-1.

Role.Name: Schema Editor
Role.Description: Gannon edited the schema for ISO 17469-2 to make technical corrections.

Role.Name: ISO 17469-2 Editor
Role.Description: Betsy will put the standards document in final form for submission to ISO.

TargetResult.Description: Publication of Part 2 as an ISO standard.
Revision of Part 2 in the ANSI process to accommodate changes to Part 1 made in the ISO process and to make additional, minor enhancements.

ActualResult.Description: The schema was put in near-final form for discussion on the StratML Committee's teleconference on June 19. The standards document itself (ISO 17469-2) has also been drafted but will need to be edited to include the latest revision of the schema documentation/data dictionary.
An insufficient number of countries agreed to take up Part 2 in the ISO process. So enhancements will be pursued in the ANSI process instead.

Goal.Name: Additional Elements
Goal.Description: Specify and foster usage of an XML standard extending Parts 1 and 2 to include the additional information deemed to be worthy of consideration for inclusion in strategic and performance plans and reports.

Role.Name: Schema Developer
Role.Description: Developed the schema for Part 3.

Role.Name: InfoPath Developer
Role.Description: Developed an InfoPath form for StratML Part 3.

Role.Name: Data Dictionary Developer
Role.Description: Prepared the data dictionary for Part 3.

Role.Name: CAM Template Evaluator
Role.Description: Prepared a CAM template evaluation and PNG graphic for Part 3: http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/references/Webber/Strat3-NDR-tech-eval.html & http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/references/Webber/STRAT3-model.png

Objective.Name: GPRAMA
Objective.Description: Include additional elements required to more fully address data requirements implicit in the GPRA Modernization Act (GPRAMA).

Role.Name: Implementation
Role.Description: U.S. federal agencies are required by section 10 of the GPRAMA to publish their strategic and performance plans and reports in machine-readable format, like StratML.

TargetResult.Description: Incorporation of StratML into the Performance.gov site.

ActualResult.Description: Elements of the StratML standard have been documented in an entity relationship diagram depicting the elements of the Performance.gov site, as shown at http://stratml.us/omb/PDSERD20111206.pdf

The elements of StratML Part 3 have been mapped to the elements contained in OMB Circular A-11, which contains guidance to agencies on implementation of the Government Performance and Results Act (GPRAMA). That guidance notes that XML is a machine-readable format and, thus, may be used to comply with section 10 of GPRAMA. However, it also says that comma separated values (CSV) are machine-readable and may also be used. So it remains to be seen whether agencies will use the open, machine-readable StratML standard.

In the June 28, 2019, issuance of Circular A-11, OMB indicated implementation of section of GPRAMA will be piloted with a few agencies during FY 2020. However, it is unclear what schema will be used. See http://stratml.us/carmel/iso/A11-240wStyle.xml#_aada4d70-a90a-11e9-a082-d69e4d1a686a

Objective.Name: Other Elements
Objective.Description: Incorporate elements for geospatial referencing, strategic planning frameworks, categorizations, relationships, and/or other purposes.

TargetResult.Description: Consensus on additional elements to be included, such as those listed at http://xml.govwebs.net/stratml/index.htm#Part3.

ActualResult.Description: Nearly 40 additional elements and attributes have been included in the draft schema for Part 3, and an InfoPath form has been developed as a reference implementation. An updated data dictionary has been generated for review by the Committee. However, the Committee has not reviewed or commented on it. So whether consensus can be achieved remains to be seen.
During 2013 the Committee voted to approve publication of Part 3 as an AIIM best practice, prior to placing it on the ANSI/ISO standards track.

Objective.Name: ANSI/AIIM Publication
Objective.Description: Publish Part 3, Additional Elements, as an American (ANSI/AIIM) national standard.

Role.Name: Document Drafter
Role.Description: Drafted the best practice document for Part 3.

Role.Name: Document Editor
Role.Description: Edited the best practice document for Part 3.

TargetResult.Description: Consensus on the standards document within the StratML Committee.

ActualResult.Description: A ballot was issued seeking consensus to publish Part 3 initially as an AIIM best practice, to be followed by publication as an ANSI/AIIM standard later. The results of the ballot have not yet been revealed, and based upon discussion on the Committee's November 16 teleconference, it is unclear whether consensus can be achieved on that point. Also, since AIIM failed to renew ownership of the stratml.net domain, it appears that it will be necessary to change the namespace for StratML Parts 1, 2 & 3. In any event, Part 3 cannot be finalized until that issue is resolved.

On our February 7 teleconference, the Committee agreed to publish Part 3 as an AIIM best practice during 2013 and place it on the standards track at a later time, after Part 1 has been approved as an ISO standard.
AIIM's Standards Board has approved Part 3 as a best practice, for publication as soon as editorial corrections can be made.

TargetResult.Description: Publish Part 3 as an AIIM best practice document

ActualResult.Description: On November 9, 2014, Part 3 was published as an AIIM best practice (AIIM 24: 2014) and made available to AIIM members free of charge at https://www.aiim.org/Resources/Standards/AIIM_24

TargetResult.Description: Regularly conduct teleconferences, as necessary, to receive input and feedback from Committee members on the elements and structure of StratML Part 3.

ActualResult.Description: Nine Committee teleconferences were conducted in 2012, on January 12 & 26, February 9, March 1 & 15, May 10 & 31, August 9, and November 16.
Seven Committee teleconferences were conducted in 2013, on January 10, February 7, May 23, June 20, July 11, September 5, and November 21.

Two Committee teleconferences were conducted in 2014, on July 31 and November 20. Most of the year was consumed waiting for editorial corrections to be made to Part 1 and Part 3 by AIIM and ISO staff.
